В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS sit with HOMELESS MAN.

DidnВ’t I just give you a dollar? В В В В В В В В В  No response. PEMBLETON (cont.)

(puts hand on chest)

(to BAYLISS)
The guy I see is late forties, early

(to PEMBLETON)

You see this guy, Black, late forties,

An automatic.
If you say so.
After this guy shoots Giardello,

I dunno.
Whaddya mean, В“I dunnoВ”?
(to PEMBLETON)
You gotta stop with the evil eye,

(to BAYLISS)
Can I have that other dollar now? В В В В В В В В В  On PEMBLETON and BAYLISS, exchanging a look,В

text: 41В В В В В  INT. PEMBLETONВ’S TOYOTA - DAY В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON drives.В  BAYLISS rides shotgun.

В В В В В В В В В  BOLANDER and MUNCH sit across from JOHN KOMEN, forties, В В В В В В В В В  greying temples.

going to be interviewed this week on

В В В В В В В В В  Still a Crime Scene.В  Area of shooting taped off.В  PEMBLETON В В В В В В В В В  and BAYLISS talk to WITNESS #1.

IВ’ve told you and them other

I didnВ’t see nothing.
And IВ’ve told you a hundred times,

Because youВ’re afraid.
Me?В  IВ’m not afraid of nobody.

Of the man who shot Al Giardello.
YouВ’re afraid if he finds out that

looking to you.В  Give В‘em something.

(exhales)
You two, go to В‘YAT, find out who
the guy is. В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS head for exit.
В‘Spoken like a champ.В  Like a true
murder police.
Kiss my ass. В В В В В В В В В  On GHARTY, sweating,
and FALSONE stand with an OLD WOMAN.
Yes, sir, I saw the man clear as

The well dressed man.
Forty or so.В  Grey at the temples
Distinguished --
Black?

(to BALLARD)

90В В В В В В  INT. NEWS MANAGERВ’S OFFICE/WYAT
sits with PEMBLETON and BAYLISS.

Eric Thomas James.

91В В В В В В  INT. GIARDELLOВ’S ROOM/ICU/CHURCH
В В В В В В В В В  MIKE enters.В  GIARDELLO sits with plate of gnocchi.
Dad...

Pembleton?В  Huh.
That does not smell like hospital
food.

Heaven.
The Doctor wonВ’t let me have any.
Mangia?
If IВ’d known.В  I just got through
wolfed down some bad Chinese take-
out.
Michael, just because youВ’re a cop,
doesnВ’t mean you have to eat like a

YouВ’ve always said that --
IВ’ve never considered indigestion

When I was a beat cop, my partners

Many years ago.В  Before you were

I never knew that.
It was September.В  It was hot.

Policemen, workmen, the most common

Bene.

Good.В  Buona notte --
Buona notte, Poppa. В В В В В В В В В  MIKE leans over and kisses GIARDELLO on cheek.В  On GIARDELLO, В В В В В В В В В  smiling, as MIKE exits,
В В В В В В В В В  Establishing.
В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS exit Toyota, walk up to a well-kept, В В В В В В В В В  cookie cutter suburban Home.В  BAYLISS RINGS the bell.В  JAMES В В В В В В В В В  opens door.

Yes. В В В В В В В В В  BAYLISS flashes his shield.
Baltimore Homicide.В  IВ’m Detective

Frank Pembleton. В В В В В В В В В  JAMES holds open the door.
Sure.В  Come in. В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS enter.
В В В В В В В В В  They step in, JAMES closes the door.
IВ’ve got some coffee.

IВ’ll take a cup, thanks.
I know itВ’s late -- В В В В В В В В В  JAMES pours BAYLISS a cup of coffee. JAMES (cont.)
But I donВ’t sleep much anyway. В В В В В В В В В  JAMES hands BAYLISS coffee.

YouВ’re welcome.В  IВ’ve been expecting

WhyВ’s that? В В В В В В В В В  JAMES looks at them, exits Kitchen, PEMBLETON and BAYLISS В В В В В В В В В  follow.

В В В В В В В В В  JAMES heads off to Bedroom right off the Kitchen.В  PEMBLETON В В В В В В В В В  and BAYLISS follow, a buzz of wariness to their step.В  JAMES В В В В В В В В В  opens Bedroom door.В  BAYLISS slides his hand to his weapon.
В В В В В В В В В  A typical teenagerВ’s Bedroom.В  Unmade bed.В  Clothes, soda В В В В В В В В В  cans, CDВ’s video games, school books litter the floor.
This is my boyВ’s bedroom.

ago.В  It hasnВ’t been touched. В В В В В В В В В  BAYLISS guides JAMES to a wall, frisks him. JAMES (cont.)

What, you donВ’t trust me?

And at the hospital this afternoon?
I was working.В  Lemme tell you

him get ahold of a decent used car

ago.В  DidnВ’t say for where.В  IВ’d
guess her sisterВ’s in Buffalo, but I

that man this morning.В  Giardello.

(smiles, looks away)

to do?В  I donВ’t deserve my Tommy

Yes.
IВ’m sorry.
What for?В  You didnВ’t know him
No one should have a child die.

want to legalize drugs.В  Who want
everyone to have the right to get
themselves high on anything they

Why should I expect my boy to go

And this is how Tommy leaves his

Giardello, because he wants to

I understand. В В В В В В В В В  JAMES and BAYLISS exchange a look.В  BAYLISS stands JAMES up, В В В В В В В В В  reflexively reaches for his cuffs, turns to PEMBLETON. BAYLISS (cont.)

You donВ’t need В‘em. В В В В В В В В В  BAYLISS and PEMBLETON lead JAMES out of the Room, into:

В В В В В В В В В  BAYLISS guides JAMES.В  PEMBLETON picks up the video camera with В В В В В В В В В  cover, off side table.В  He examines it, opens cover.В  He В В В В В В В В В  shows it to BAYLISS: James has rigged the gun to the camera. Congratulations.

В В В В В В В В В  Normal activity as PEMBLETON and BAYLISS pass through.

В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS step out. BAYLISS (cont.)

TheyВ’re not going to.В  ItВ’s not going

В‘cause in his heart of hearts, he

Luke Ryland.
Huh?
I shot the bastard dead.

IВ’m not kidding.В  I killed him.

murdered another innocent woman. В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON stares hard at BAYLISS.
DonВ’t screw with me. В В В В В В В В В  BAYLISS looks at PEMBLETON, no joke. PEMBLETON (cont.)
You killed this whoever.
Luke Ryland.

Frank, IВ’m saying I went to hunt
this bastard down.В  I found him and
blew his brains out.В  I executed him

And IВ’m saying, Internal rules it

Internal doesnВ’t know crap about me

YouВ’re standing here and youВ’re
telling me you killed someone.
Yes.
In self-defense.
No.
You were standing there with your
gun and then it went off and you
donВ’t remember how.
Frank --
В‘Cause guns go off accidentally.
Happens all the time.
This was no accident.
IВ’m saying itВ’s an accident.В  For
you to shoot someone, it has to be a
mistake.
No mistake, no accident.
Tim --
YouВ’re a good cop.
IВ’m not a cop anymore.
YouВ’ll always be a cop.
IВ’m a teacher now.В  A civilian.
I murdered this guy, В‘cause he was a
predator.В  He preyed on women.

I put the gun right up to the motherВ’s
brain and I pulled the trigger.
Shut up. Just -- shut up.
What do I do, Frank?
You put this on me?В  You sunofabitch.
You have a conscience.В  I have one.
I donВ’t know why mine keeps kicking
me, but it does.В  All the time.
(taps his chest, open-
palmed)
HereВ  IВ’m okay with it.В  In my heart,
I know I saved some girlВ’s life.
Some girl in New Orleans.В  Who will
never know.В  ThatВ’s where Ryland was
headed.В  He said the girls were В“easyВ”
there.В  HeВ’d have В“accessВ” --
(taps his temple)
But here? В В В В В В В В В  Pause.В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS exchange a look.
I come back for this.
Maybe itВ’s В‘cause this James guy
heВ’s going to jail for basically the
same reasons I had for doing what I
did.В  And IВ’m out here.В  Free.
You wait В‘til IВ’m back and then you
have to unload, huh?В  Unburden
yourself... WhatВ’s supposed to happen
now?
You tell me.
IВ’m not bringing you in.
No, huh?
IВ’m not a cop.В  IВ’m not official.
So youВ’ll what, not tell anyone?
Keep my secret to yourself?
Sunofabitch.В  YouВ’re a sunofabitch.
You murdered him.
Yes.
WhoВ’s the primary?
Lewis.
You talk to him?
YouВ’re the first to know.В  Who else
was I going to tell?
But did you talk to Lewis?
About the case?В  No.
No one suspects it was you.
CВ’mon, me?В  WhoВ’d suspect me?В  Good
old Tim Bayliss.В  The Zen Detective.
Hunh.
So youВ’ll take me in.
IВ’m going to take you in?В  Are you wild?
YouВ’ll take me in.
No.
Did I take a bullet for you once?

Did I?
IВ’m not taking you in.
I take one for you, you take one for

This is you wanting me to toss your

No.

No.
I thought about eating my gun.В  I

(taps temple)
-- for here -- then thereВ’s only one

Tim, cops in prison -- not a pretty

I respect you, Frank, I love... you... В В В В В В В В В  PEMBLETON and BAYLISS look off, then back at each other.
You thought about putting a gun to

YouВ’d be saving my life.В  I donВ’t
know for how long, but for now, at

I believe that you didnВ’t mean to do

If thatВ’s what you want to believe.

It has to be what it has to be.
Sonofabitch.
Frank, do you absolve me?
Absolve you?В  I canВ’t.
CanВ’tВ  You mean you wonВ’t.
I canВ’t.В  Can not.В  ItВ’s not within
my power... В В В В В В В В В  BAYLISS takes his badge out of his pocket, hands it to
PEMBLETON looks at it a moment, puts it in his В В В В В В В В В  pocket, looks out at the sky. PEMBLETON (cont.)

SHEPPARD, FALSONE, DANVERS and Medical В В В В В В В В В  Examiners Doctor LAUSANNE and Doctor SCHEINER sit, drinking. В В В В В В В В В  BILLIE LOU tends bar.В  COX raises a glass to the room.

Says me.В  So... To Bayliss and

To new friends. В В В В В В В В В  ALL toast, hear-hear.В  LEWIS raises his glass.

Hear, hear.

To partners. В В В В В В В В В  ALL toast, hear-hear.В  BRODIE enters.

ThatВ’s what the doctor said. В В В В В В В В В  BOLANDER turns to HOWARD, takes her hand.В  BALLARD starts to В В В В В В В В В  cry.В  FALSONE comforts her.В  KELLERMAN and COX hug.В  STIVERS В В В В В В В В В  leans on DANVERS.В  SCHEINER, GRISCOM, SHEPPARD and LAUSANNE В В В В В В В В В  exchange a mournful glance.В  BILLIE LOU puts her hand on В В В В В В В В В  MUNCHВ’s shoulder.В  LEWIS rises, exits.

В В В В В В В В В  MIKE stands there, looks around.В  He tries to feel his В В В В В В В В В  fatherВ’s presence.В  He finds one picture on the wall of В В В В В В В В В  Giardello, takes Rosary out of his pocket and hangs it on В В В В В В В В В  corner of frame.В  PEMBLETON enters.
